application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: Group 10	Mixed species Prune 1 elder crown and 1 ash limb (both pictured) back to grass verge so they do not overhang the parking spaces.Group 12	Mixed species Remove major deadwood from the first and third ash trees in from the north side of the group overhanging the car park.Group 13	Norway maple, Common ash Remove Broken/Hanging Branch In tree adjacent to ash tagged 152.Group 13	Norway maple, Common ash	Remove Dead Wood Remove major deadwood overhanging road from ash tagged 152.2	Common hawthorn	Fell to Ground Level (Directional Fell)7	Horse chestnut	Remove Dead Wood Remove all dead wood and dead limbs.17	Cedar of lebanon	Clean Out Crown Remove deadwood and tidy snap/rip wounds. Reduce limbs overhanging car park by 5m. Sever and Remove Ivy to 1.5m Above Ground Level18	Irish yew	Remove Broken/Hanging Branch South side of tree overhanging pipes.19	False acacia	Clear vegetation to allow access to basal areas of trees for inspection purposes Remove all ivy and vegetation surrounding tree ahead of recommended early summer 2025 inspection.30	Cherry species	Sever and Remove Ivy to 1.5m Above Ground Level Ahead of the next recommended inspection.36	Cherry species	Dismantle to ground level42	Common laburnum	Fell to Ground Level (Directional Fell)44	Common alder	Fell to Ground Level (Directional Fell)49	Cherry species	Crown Reduce in Height by Specified Amount & Shape Reduce long reaching limbs by 1m to clear parking spaces and shape to create a symmetrical crown.55	Common ash	Dismantle to ground level59	Goat willow	Dismantle to ground level60	Common hawthorn	Dismantle to ground level61	Sycamore	Dismantle to ground level Remove established limb.62	Field maple	Fell to Ground Level (Directional Fell)63	Common ash	Dismantle to ground level64	English elm	Fell to Ground Level (Directional Fell)65	Sycamore	Dismantle to ground level66	Sycamore	Dismantle to ground level67	Sycamore	Dismantle to ground level68	Common lime	Remove Basal and Epicormic Growth
